text: built a little PoC of the Immediate-Mode ad-hoc scripting idea, and recorded a demo video: <https://youtu.be/zlG01j462A4>

root.text:
very short braindump of <#CLYCGTCPL|end-user-programming> in the context for electronics-engineering CAD applications:
<https://twitter.com/S0lll0s/status/1182280165306572802>
<https://gist.github.com/s-ol/8b747a43f047d20997c7dfe26edd9712>

anyone know anything similar? I know libfive and antimony, which are very related but for solid-modeling. Since electronic engineers are usually at least somewhat familiar with writing code that seems to me like a more feasible product

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/S0lll0s|@S0lll0s>: <https://twitter.com/GregDavill|@GregDavill> EE, being programming-adjacent, is a great testing ground for end-user programming like that. The KiCAD/pcbnew python API is great but i would love to see a UX that lends itself more to ad-hoc REPL-ish programmatic access to the PCB
attachments.text: <https://twitter.com/GregDavill|@GregDavill> EE, being programming-adjacent, is a great testing ground for end-user programming like that. The KiCAD/pcbnew python API is great but i would love to see a UX that lends itself more to ad-hoc REPL-ish programmatic access to the PCB

attachments.title: Proof of Concept: Immediate-Mode In-Canvas Tools for CAD-ish Applications
